responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Insecure default permission assignment in start script
    analysis: |
      The start.sh script, used to start the MTProxy server, doesn't specify the permission mask for the newly created files or directories.
      This could lead to files being created with world-writable permissions, allowing any user on the system to modify them.
      An attacker could potentially modify the configuration files used by the MTProxy server, leading to a privilege escalation or denial of service.
    cwe: CWE-276
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - start.sh
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Insecure default permission assignment in start script
leads.analysis:
The start.sh script, used to start the MTProxy server, doesn't specify the permission mask for the newly created files or directories.
This could lead to files being created with world-writable permissions, allowing any user on the system to modify them.
An attacker could potentially modify the configuration files used by the MTProxy server, leading to a privilege escalation or denial of service.
